content:
Posting here for visibility:

Installation fails in Ubuntu 20.04 (due to rabbitmq-server) #23639

I just installed zulip on a fresh Ubuntu server and sadly have to report that it did not work out of the box just using the install script.

Maybe its a special version or other circumstances, but the Ubuntu i got at Strato (Provider) was not able to configure rabbitmq-server using the latest default version.

I had to follow the official install guide which included adding their package repo.
https://www.rabbitmq.com/install-debian.html
This way i was able to install rabbitmq-server and thus the zulip install script was able to finish without errors.

I forgot to lookup the version of rabbitmq-server it tried to install without the external package repo.
But this ticket may serve as help to someone facing the same install problem.

And if its not just a (maybe) different Ubuntu version of my provider, this needs to be fixed for the installer.
This sounds like #production help > trouble with zulip install at list_supervisor_processes.
